title: Headphone, Battery and Phone Call issues since update in early April 2019
content:
I'm on Android 9 with the last security patch on April 5. This last update royally messed up my phone.

I can't receive or make phone calls without rebooting my phone first. The phone rings and vibrates but the button to answer won't show up, or it shows up and I answer and it's silent and the other person can't hear me.

My headphones won't work unless I reboot. I've tried 3 sets of headphones with different apps and it's the same. I also tried deleting my bluetooth paired devices to no effect.

The day after the update my battery suddenly dropped to 3% from 52% as I was looking at my phone trying to answer a phone call.

Really hoping I don't have to do a factory reset but thinking it might be my only option at this point. I'm rebooting my phone 5x a day.

Any advice would be greatly appreciated!
